question.title: I am trying to write a custom gradle plugin in java, but while publishing I can only see pom file in local .m2 folder
question.body:
I have a root project's build.gradle and many subprojects, in one of the subprojects, inside the package com.org.common.libr.gradle I created the gradle plugin GradleBuildHelperPlugin. Also created a file within resources/META-INF/gradle-plugins/gradle-build-helper.properties which contains

implementation-class=com.org.common.libr.gradle.GradleBuildHelperPlugin

here is how my build.gradle file looks like for the sub-project in which I have created a Java gradle plugin

plugins {
    id 'java-gradle-plugin'
    id 'maven-publish'
}
apply from: "${rootProject.rootDir}/config.gradle"
version = "${majorVersion}.${buildNumber}.${patchVersion}"

if (prefix && !prefix.equals("master")) {
    version = prefix + "-SNAPSHOT"
}

/ Set of dependencies for the project
dependencies {
    implementation gradleApi()
    compile "org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-core:${versions.log4j2}"
    compile "org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-api:${versions.log4j2}"
    //few other dependencies
}
gradlePlugin {
    plugins {
        csPlugins {
            id = 'cs-build-helper'
            implementationClass = 'com.org.common.libr.gradle.GradleBuildHelperPlugin'
        }
    }
}
publishing {
    publications {
        buildPlugin(MavenPublication) {
            from components.java
        }
    }
}

but when see the folder

/Users/user1/.m2/repository/cs-build-helper/cs-build-helper.gradle.plugin/1.local.0

only the

cs-build-helper.gradle.plugin-1.local.0.pom

There is no implementation class file. How can we fix this issue?
